00099 typedef struct tcounter 
00100 {
00101   unsigned long tlo;
00102   long thi;
00103 } tcounter_t;
00104 
00105 inline void gettsc(long long int* utime) 
00106 {
00107   unsigned long Lo;
00108   long Hi;
00109   tcounter_t* tc = (tcounter_t*)utime;
00110   rdtsc(Lo,Hi);
00111   tc->tlo = Lo;
00112   tc->thi = Hi;
00113 }
00114 
00115 inline unsigned long hi_word(unsigned long long u) 
00116 {
00117   unsigned long * ptr = (unsigned long *)&u;
00118   return *(ptr+1);
00119 }
00120 
00121 inline unsigned long lo_word(unsigned long long u) 
00122 {
00123   unsigned long * ptr = (unsigned long *)&u;
00124   return *ptr;
00125 }
00126 
00127 #endif

00129 #if 0
00130 #define IS_SYS_CALL(regs)       (((regs).orig_eax>=0) &&                \
00131                                  ((regs).eax == -ERESTARTNOHAND ||      \
00132                                   (regs).eax == -ERESTARTSYS ||         \
00133                                   (regs).eax == -ERESTARTNOINTR) ) 
00134 #endif
00135 
00136 #define IS_FD_NAMED(fdes)       ((fdes)->f_dentry->d_name.name)

00139 static int do_checkpoint(int fd, struct task_struct * p, int flags);
00140 
00141 static char * get_kernel_address(struct task_struct * p, struct vm_area_struct *vm, unsigned long addr);
00142 
00151 static int is_sys_call(struct task_struct *p, struct pt_regs * regs) 
00152 {
00153   char *ins1, *ins2;
00154   if (regs->orig_ax <= 0 || regs->orig_ax > NR_syscalls)
00155     return 0;
00156   
00157   ins1 = get_kernel_address(p, find_vma(p->mm, regs->ip - 2), regs->ip - 2);
00158   ins2 = get_kernel_address(p, find_vma(p->mm, regs->ip - 1), regs->ip - 1);
00159   if (ins1 && ins2 && (*ins1 == (char)0xcd) && (*ins2 == (char)0x80))
00160     return 1;
00161   else
00162     return 0;
00163 }
00164 
00177 static int checkpoint(int fd, pid_t pid, int flags) 
00178 {
00179   struct task_struct *p;
00180   struct file *f;
00181   int ret;
00182   int stop = 0;
00183 #ifdef PRINT_TIME
00184   long long hr_time1, hr_time2;
00185   gettsc(&hr_time1);
00186 #endif  
00187         
00188   f  = fcheck(fd);
00189   if (!f){
00190     if(verbose) printk("Error: Bad fd.");
00191     return -EBADF;
00192   }
00193         
00194   p = ckpt_find_task_by_pid(pid);
00195                 
00196   if (!p){
00197     if(verbose) printk("Error: No such pid.");
00198     return -ESRCH; /* no such pid */
00199   }
00200 
00201   if (((p->uid != current->euid && p->uid != current->uid)
00202        && (current->uid && current->euid))
00203       || !ckptable(p)){
00204     if(verbose) printk("Error: Not accessible.");
00205     return -EACCES;    
00206   } 
00207 
00208   // we don't checkpoint a currently running process.
00209   // stop it first.     
00210   if (p != current) {
00211     send_sig(SIGSTOP, p, 0);
00212     stop = 1;
00213   }
00214         
00215   if ((ret = do_checkpoint(fd, p, flags)) != 0)
00216     return ret;
00217 
00218   if (stop)
00219     send_sig(SIGCONT, p, 0);
00220         
00221   if (flags & CKPT_KILL)
00222     send_sig(SIGKILL, p, 0); /* kill it if possible */
00223 
00224 #ifdef PRINT_TIME
00225   gettsc(&hr_time2);
00226   printk("checkpoint %s: %lu, %lu\n", p->comm, hi_word(hr_time2 - hr_time1), lo_word(hr_time2 - hr_time1));
00227 #endif  
00228         
00229   return 0;
00230 }
00231 
00232 static inline int inside(unsigned long a,
00233                          unsigned long b,
00234                          unsigned long c) 
00235 {
00236   return (c <= b) && (c >= a);
00237 }
00238 
00254 static inline int valid_memory_segment (struct pt_regs regs, struct mm_struct *mm, 
00255                                         struct vm_area_struct *vma) 
00256 { 
00257   if (inside(mm->start_code, mm->end_code, vma->vm_start))
00258     return 1;
00259   else if (inside(mm->end_code, mm->end_data, vma->vm_start))
00260     return 1;
00261   else if (inside(mm->end_data, mm->brk, vma->vm_start))
00262     return 1;
00263   else if (inside(mm->start_stack, 0xC0000000, vma->vm_start))
00264     return 1;
00265   else if (inside(vma->vm_start, vma->vm_end, regs.sp))
00266     return 1;
00267   else
00268     return 0;   
00269 }
00270 
00282 static int pack_write (struct file *f, char *buf, int len, int last_pkt, int flag) 
00283 {
00284   static char *pack = NULL;
00285   static long pos = 0;
00286   int ret, to_copy, wrtn = 0;
00287 
00288   // Allocate the packet.
00289   if (pack==NULL)       {
00290     pack=(char*)kmalloc(PACKET_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
00291     if (!pack)
00292       return -1;
00293   }     
00294 
00295   // While there's data to copy, continue.
00296   while (len>0) {
00297 
00298     // Determine amount of data to copy this round.
00299     to_copy = (len>(PACKET_SIZE-pos))?(PACKET_SIZE-pos):(len);
00300 
00301     // Determine source of data and procedure to follow.
00302     if (flag==FROM_USER)
00303       copy_from_user(&(pack[pos]), buf+wrtn, to_copy);
00304     else
00305       ckpt_strncpy(&(pack[pos]), buf+wrtn, to_copy);
00306 
00307     // Update progress vars.
00308     pos += to_copy;
00309     len -= to_copy;
00310     wrtn +=to_copy; 
00311 
00312     // If we've reached the last data.
00313     if ( (pos==PACKET_SIZE) || (last_pkt) )     {
00314       mm_segment_t fs = get_fs();
00315 
00316       set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
00317       ret = f->f_op->write(f, pack, pos, &(f->f_pos));  
00318       set_fs(fs);
00319       if (ret!=pos)
00320         return ret;
00321                                 
00322       pos = 0;
00323       if (last_pkt)
00324         {
00325           kfree(pack);
00326           pack = NULL;
00327         }
00328     }
00329   }
00330         
00331   if ( (last_pkt) && (pack!=NULL) ) {
00332     if (pos!=0) {
00333       mm_segment_t fs = get_fs();
00334 
00335       set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
00336       wrtn = f->f_op->write(f, pack, pos, &f->f_pos);
00337       set_fs(fs);
00338     }
00339     kfree(pack);
00340     pack = NULL;
00341     pos = 0;
00342   }     
00343   return wrtn;
00344 }
00345 
00346 
00356 static char * get_kernel_address(struct task_struct * p,
00357                                  struct vm_area_struct *vm,
00358                                  unsigned long addr) 
00359 {
00360   pgd_t *pgd;
00361   pmd_t *page_middle;
00362   pte_t *pte;
00363           
00364   pgd = pgd_offset(p->mm, addr);
00365 
00366   if (ckpt_pgd_none(*pgd)) {
00367     printk("none pgd: %08lx\n", (unsigned long)pgd);
00368     return NULL;
00369   }
00370 
00371   if (ckpt_pgd_bad(*pgd)) {
00372     printk("bad pgd: %08lx\n", (unsigned long)pgd);
00373     pgd_ERROR(*pgd);
00374     return NULL;
00375   }
00376         
00377   page_middle = ckpt_pmd_offset(pgd, addr);
00378   if (pmd_none(*page_middle))
00379     return NULL;
00380 
00381   if (pmd_bad(*page_middle)) {
00382     printk("Bad page middle entry %08lx\n", pmd_val(*page_middle));
00383     return NULL;
00384   }
00385 
00386   // hmmm..currently I am not dealing with swap-in for non-present pmd..
00388   if (!pmd_present(*page_middle)) {
00389     printk("Non-present page middle entry %08lx\n", pmd_val(*page_middle));
00390     return NULL;
00391   }
00392 
00393   pte = pte_offset_kernel(page_middle,addr);
00394 
00395   if (pte == NULL) {
00396     printk("NULL pte\n");
00397     return NULL;
00398   }
00399   
00405   /*
00406   if (!pte_present(*pte)) {
00407      * If it truly wasn't present, we know that kswapd
00408      * and the PTE updates will not touch it later. So
00409      * drop the lock.
00410     spin_lock(&p->mm->page_table_lock);
00411     if (pte_none(*pte)){
00412       ckpt_do_no_page(p->mm, vm, addr, vm->vm_flags&VM_MAYWRITE, pte);
00413     }
00414     else{
00415       ckpt_do_swap_page(p->mm, vm, addr, pte, pte_to_swp_entry(*pte), 0);
00416     }
00417     spin_unlock(&p->mm->page_table_lock);
00418   }
00419   */
00420 
00421   if (!pte_present(*pte)) {
00422     printk("ERROR: Page for %08lx still not present!\n", addr);
00423     return NULL;
00424   }
00425 
00426   return (char *) page_address(pte_page(*pte)) + (addr & ~PAGE_MASK);
00427 }
00428 
00436 static int dump_vm_area(struct file *f, struct task_struct * p,
00437                         struct vm_area_struct *vm) 
00438 {
00439   char * data;
00440   unsigned long addr = vm->vm_start;
00441 
00442   /* we may write to the pgtable */
00443   down_write(&p->mm->mmap_sem);
00444 
00445   while (addr < vm->vm_end) {
00446 
00447     data = get_kernel_address(p, vm, addr);
00448 
00449     if (data) {
00450       if ((unsigned long)data & ~PAGE_MASK)     
00451         printk("Warning: address %8lx not aligned!\n", (unsigned long)data);
00452     
00453       if (pack_write(f, (void*)data, PAGE_SIZE, 0, FROM_KERNEL) != PAGE_SIZE)
00454         printk("Warning: not all dumped\n");
00455     }
00456     else {
00457       printk ("Page not found! vm_start %08lx, vm_end %08lx, addr %08lx\n",
00458               vm->vm_start, vm->vm_end, addr);
00459     }
00460     
00461     addr += PAGE_SIZE;
00462   }
00463 
00464   up_write(&p->mm->mmap_sem);
00465   return 0;
00466 }  
00467 
00484 int do_checkpoint(int fd, struct task_struct * p, int flags) 
00485 {
00486   struct file *f;
00487   struct vm_area_struct *vm;
00488   struct header hdr;
00489   struct memory mem;
00490   struct segments seg;
00491   struct open_files_hdr open_files_hdr;
00492   struct open_files open_files;
00493   struct files_struct * files;
00494   struct pt_regs regs;
00495   struct path * pth;
00496   mm_segment_t fs;
00497   unsigned char no_shrlib, no_binary;
00498   int memleft, fds;
00499   int ret, i, j, filecnt;
00500 
00501   char * buffer = 0;
00502   char * line = 0;
00503 
00504   /*
00505    * This is added to cache fds that have been checked.
00506    * If the current fd has the same inode as a previous fd,
00507    * we should put it as type CKPT_DUP and recover with dup2.
00508    */
00509   int fdcache_size = 0;
00510   struct ckpt_fdcache_struct *fdcache = 0;
00511 
00512   // Allocate path now, so we won't have to later.
00513   pth = (struct path*) kmalloc(sizeof(struct path), GFP_KERNEL);
00514         
00515   task_lock(current);
00516   f = current->files->fdt->fd[fd]; 
00517   task_unlock(current);
00518 
00519   memleft = PAGE_SIZE;
00520 
00521   files = p->files;
00522 
00524   regs = *(((struct pt_regs *) (2*PAGE_SIZE + (unsigned long) p)) - 1);
00525 
00526   // now fs is valid
00527   fs = get_fs();
00528 
00529   /* Dump the header */
00530   ckpt_strncpy(hdr.signature, "CKPT", 4);
00531   hdr.major_version = CKPT_MAJOR;
00532   hdr.minor_version = CKPT_MINOR;
00533 
00534   /* Count number of virtual memory segments. Store in i. */
00535   for (i=0, vm = p->mm->mmap; vm!=NULL; i++,vm = vm->vm_next); //<- semicolon
00536 
00537   /********************* SAVE THE HEADER ****************************/
00538   hdr.num_segments = i;
00539 
00540   task_lock(p);
00541   hdr.pid = p->pid;
00542   hdr.uid = p->uid;
00543   hdr.euid = p->euid;
00544   hdr.suid = p->suid;
00545   hdr.fsuid = p->fsuid;
00546   hdr.gid = p->gid;
00547   hdr.egid = p->egid;
00548   hdr.sgid = p->sgid;
00549   hdr.fsgid = p->fsgid;
00550   hdr.ngroups = p->group_info->ngroups;
00551   hdr.in_sys_call = is_sys_call(p, &regs);
00552 
00553   ckpt_strncpy(hdr.comm, p->comm, 16);
00554   task_unlock(p);
00555         
00556   no_shrlib = (flags & CKPT_NO_SHARED_LIBRARIES);
00557   no_binary = (flags & CKPT_NO_BINARY_FILE);
00558   if (verbose)
00559     printk("Saving header: %d segments\n",hdr.num_segments);
00560 
00561   // set now
00562   set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
00563 
00564   pack_write(f, (void*)&hdr, sizeof(struct header), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00565   memleft -= sizeof(struct header);
00566 
00567   /********************* SAVE THE MEMORY ****************************/
00568 
00569   task_lock(p);
00570   mem.start_code  = p->mm->start_code;
00571   mem.end_code    = p->mm->end_code;
00572   mem.start_data  = p->mm->start_data;
00573   mem.end_data    = p->mm->end_data;
00574   mem.start_brk   = p->mm->start_brk;
00575   mem.brk         = p->mm->brk;
00576   mem.start_stack = p->mm->start_stack;
00577   mem.arg_start   = p->mm->arg_start;
00578   mem.arg_end     = p->mm->arg_end;
00579   mem.env_start   = p->mm->env_start;
00580   mem.env_end     = p->mm->env_end;
00581   task_unlock(p);
00582 
00583   if (verbose)
00584     printk("Saving vm structure\n");
00585   pack_write(f, (void*)&mem, sizeof(struct memory), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00586   memleft -= sizeof(struct memory);
00587 
00588   // dump segments
00589   ret = -ENOMEM;
00590   buffer = (char*)__get_free_page(GFP_KERNEL);
00591   if (!buffer)
00592     goto out;
00593         
00594   if (verbose)
00595     printk("Saving segments\n");
00596 
00597   
00598   /********************* SAVE THE SEGMENTS ****************************/
00599   for (i=0, vm = p->mm->mmap; vm!=NULL; i++, vm = vm->vm_next) {
00600     unsigned char valid_mem;
00601                 
00602     seg.vm_start = vm->vm_start;
00603     seg.vm_end   = vm->vm_end;
00604     seg.prot     = vm->vm_page_prot.pgprot;
00605     seg.flags    = vm->vm_flags;
00606     seg.shared   = 0;
00607     seg.pgoff   = vm->vm_pgoff;
00608     seg.filename[0] = 0;
00609           
00610     valid_mem = valid_memory_segment(regs, p->mm, vm);
00611     if ( ((no_binary && valid_mem) || (no_shrlib && !valid_mem)) &&
00612          // if this is a code segment or shared library
00613          ( !(seg.flags&VM_WRITE) || (seg.flags&VM_MAYSHARE)) ) {
00614       // and it's not writable or it's shared
00615       // then we can safely map the original file
00616               
00617       if (vm->vm_file) {
00618         struct path pth;
00619         pth.mnt = vm->vm_file->f_vfsmnt;
00620         pth.dentry = vm->vm_file->f_dentry;
00621         line = d_path(&pth, buffer, PAGE_SIZE);
00622         buffer[PAGE_SIZE-1] = 0;
00623         seg.shared = 1;
00624         ckpt_strncpy(seg.filename, line, CKPT_MAX_FILENAME);
00625       }
00626     }
00627           
00628     /* Dump all segments' header */
00629     pack_write(f, (void*)&seg, sizeof(struct segments), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00630           
00631     if (memleft < sizeof(struct segments))
00632       memleft = PAGE_SIZE + memleft;
00633     memleft -= sizeof(struct segments);
00634   }
00635         
00636   /* Dump the padding so the header is a mutiple of a page size */
00637   if (memleft > 0) {
00638     char *padbuf;
00639     padbuf = (char*)kmalloc(memleft, GFP_KERNEL);
00640     pack_write(f, padbuf, memleft, 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00641     kfree(padbuf);
00642   }
00643 
00644   set_fs(fs);
00645 
00646   if (verbose)
00647     printk("Saving vm areas\n");
00648 
00649   for (i = 0, vm = p->mm->mmap; vm!=NULL; i++, vm = vm->vm_next) {
00650     unsigned char valid_mem;
00651 
00652     /* Dump the memory segment */
00653     valid_mem = valid_memory_segment(regs, p->mm, vm);
00654 
00655     /* Dump pages and shared libs if we are allowed to */
00656 
00657     if (!( ((no_binary && valid_mem) || (no_shrlib && !valid_mem)) &&
00658            ( !(vm->vm_flags&VM_WRITE) || (vm->vm_flags&VM_MAYSHARE)) &&
00659            vm->vm_file )) {
00660             
00661       if (dump_vm_area(f, p, vm)) {
00662         ret = -EAGAIN;
00663         goto out;
00664       }
00665     }
00666   }
00667 
00668   set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
00669 
00670   /********************* SAVE THE REGISTERS ****************************/
00671   if (verbose)
00672     printk("Saving registers\n");
00673 
00674   if (p == current)
00675     regs.ax = 0; // avoid infinite loop!
00676   /* If we are in a system call, we must restart it */
00677   else if (hdr.in_sys_call) {
00678     regs.ip -= 2;
00679     regs.ax = -EINTR;
00680   }
00681         
00682   ret = pack_write(f, (void*)&regs, sizeof(regs), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00683 
00684   /* ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00685   /*   The dumps on this section are optional. They might not    */
00686   /*   occur on some circumstances, so they all start with a     */
00687   /*   common heading that tells whether or not theses sections  */
00688   /*   are present                                             */
00689   /* ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00690         
00691   /* FILE SECTION */
00692   /* Find the open fds first */
00693   // copied from close_files in exit.c
00694 
00695   // calculate how many files are opened first
00696 
00697   if (verbose)
00698     printk("Saving file table\n");
00699 
00700   filecnt = j = 0;
00701 
00702   if (!buffer)
00703     buffer = (char*)__get_free_page(GFP_KERNEL);
00704         
00705   if (!buffer)
00706     goto out;
00707         
00708   if (verbose)
00709     printk("max_fds = %d\n", files->fdt->max_fds);
00710         
00711   for (;;) {
00712     unsigned long set;
00713     fds = j * __NFDBITS;          
00714     if (fds >= files->fdt->max_fds)
00715       break;
00716     set = files->fdt->open_fds->fds_bits[j++];
00717     while (set) {
00718       if (set & 1) {
00719         if (ckpt_icheck_task(p, fds)) {
00720           filecnt++;
00721         }
00722       }
00723             
00724       fds++;
00725       set >>= 1;
00726     }
00727   }
00728 
00729   if (verbose)
00730     printk("%d named opened files\n", filecnt);
00731         
00732   open_files_hdr.number_open_files = filecnt;
00733   pack_write(f, (void*)&open_files_hdr, sizeof(struct open_files_hdr), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00734 
00735   fdcache = (struct ckpt_fdcache_struct*)kmalloc(sizeof(struct ckpt_fdcache_struct)*filecnt, GFP_KERNEL);
00736 
00737   ret = -ENOMEM;
00738         
00739   if (!fdcache)
00740     goto out;
00741         
00742   /* Now we dump them */
00743   j = 0;
00744   for (;;) {
00745     unsigned long set;
00746     fds = j * __NFDBITS;          
00747     if (fds >= files->fdt->max_fds)
00748       break;
00749     set = files->fdt->open_fds->fds_bits[j++];
00750     while (set) {
00751       if (set & 1) {
00752         struct file *fdes = fcheck_files(files, fds);
00753         struct dentry *dent = fdes ? fdes->f_dentry : NULL;
00754         struct inode *inode = dent ? dent->d_inode : NULL;
00755         int i;
00756 
00757         if (!inode)
00758           goto next;
00759               
00760         open_files.fd = fds;
00761               
00762         // check whether this inode has appeared before
00763         for (i = 0; i < fdcache_size; i++) {
00764           if (inode == fdcache[i].inode) {
00765             // cache hit
00766                   
00767             if (verbose)
00768               printk("fd %d is a dup of fd %d\n", (int)fds, fdcache[i].fd);
00769             open_files.type = CKPT_DUP;             
00770             open_files.u.dup.dupfd = fdcache[i].fd;
00771             open_files.entry_size = 0;
00772             pack_write(f, (void*)&open_files, sizeof(struct open_files), 0, FROM_KERNEL);                 
00773             goto next;
00774           }
00775         }
00776 
00777         // if not a dup, push to the cache
00778         fdcache[fdcache_size].fd = fds;
00779         fdcache[fdcache_size].inode = inode;
00780         fdcache_size++;
00781               
00782         if (!inode) {
00783           printk("fd %d has no entry\n", fds);
00784         }
00785         else if (S_ISSOCK(inode->i_mode)) {
00786           printk("fd %d is socket - unsupported\n", fds);
00787           ret = -ENOSYS;
00788           goto out;
00789         }
00790 
00791         /* *** UNNAMED PIPE *** */
00795         /*
00796         else if (S_ISFIFO(inode->i_mode))) {
00797 
00798           if (down_interruptible(PIPE_SEM(*inode))) {
00799             ret = -ERESTARTSYS;
00800             goto out;
00801           }
00802 
00803           mutex_lock(inode->i_mutex);
00804         
00805           //      PIPE_READERS(*inode)++;
00806           ++(inode->i_pipe->readers);
00807                 
00808           open_files.type = CKPT_PIPE;
00809           open_files.fd = fds;
00810 
00811           open_files.u.pipes.inode = inode->i_ino; // identity
00812           open_files.u.pipes.rdwr = (fdes->f_flags&O_WRONLY); 
00813           open_files.entry_size = PIPE_LEN(*inode);             
00814           pack_write(f, (void*)&open_files, sizeof(struct open_files), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00815                 
00816           pack_write(f, (void*)PIPE_BASE(*inode)+PIPE_START(*inode),
00817                      PIPE_LEN(*inode), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00818 
00819           PIPE_READERS(*inode)--;
00820 
00821           //      up(PIPE_SEM(*inode));
00822           mutex_unlock(inode->i_mutex);
00823         }      
00824         */
00825 
00826         /* *** REGULAR FILE *** */
00827         else if (IS_FD_NAMED(fdes)) {
00828 
00829           pth->mnt = mntget(fdes->f_vfsmnt);
00830           pth->dentry = dget(dent);
00831           line = d_path(pth, buffer, PAGE_SIZE);
00832           buffer[PAGE_SIZE-1] = 0;
00833           dput(pth->dentry);
00834           mntput(pth->mnt);
00835                 
00836           open_files.type = CKPT_FILE;
00837           open_files.fd = fds;
00838           open_files.u.file.file = (unsigned long)fdes;
00839           open_files.u.file.flags = fdes->f_flags;
00840           open_files.u.file.mode = fdes->f_mode;
00841           open_files.u.file.file_pos = fdes->f_pos;
00842 
00843           open_files.entry_size = buffer + PAGE_SIZE - line;
00844                 
00845           pack_write(f, (void*)&open_files, sizeof(struct open_files), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00846 #if 0
00847           printk("fd %d: %s (%d)\n", fds, line, open_files.entry_size);
00848 #endif          
00849           pack_write(f, (void*)line, open_files.entry_size, 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00850 
00851         }
00852         else
00853           printk("Unknown file type, cannot handle\n");
00854       }
00855 
00856     next:
00857             
00858       fds++;
00859       set >>= 1;
00860     }
00861   }
00862                 
00863   /**************************************/
00864   /*             Dump CWD               */
00865   /**************************************/
00866   {
00867     int size;
00868 
00869     pth->dentry = dget(p->fs->pwd.dentry);
00870     pth->mnt = mntget(p->fs->pwd.mnt);
00871     line = d_path(pth, buffer, PAGE_SIZE);
00872     buffer[PAGE_SIZE-1] = 0;
00873     size = buffer+PAGE_SIZE-line;
00874 
00875     dput(pth->dentry);
00876     mntput(pth->mnt);
00877     pack_write(f, (void *)&size, sizeof(size), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00878     pack_write(f, (void *)line, size, 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00879 
00880     if (verbose)
00881       printk("saving cwd: %s\n", line);
00882   }
00883 
00884   /* *************************************************************** */
00885   /* ** Dump the signal handler section.                        ** */
00886   /* *************************************************************** */
00887 
00888   if (verbose)
00889     printk("Saving signal handlers\n");
00890   {
00891     sigset_t blocked;
00892     struct signal_struct sig;
00893     unsigned long * signal = (unsigned long *)&p->pending.signal;
00894 
00895     spin_lock_irq(&p->sighand->siglock);
00896           
00897           
00898     // ignore SIGSTOP/SIGCONT     
00899     if ((_NSIG_WORDS == 2 && signal[0]) & ~(0x60000L || signal[1]))
00900       printk("pending signals not saved: %08lx %08lx\n",
00901              signal[0], signal[1]);
00902           
00903     blocked = p->blocked;
00904     sig = *(p->signal);
00905           
00906     spin_unlock_irq(&p->sighand->siglock);
00907           
00908     pack_write(f, (void*)&blocked, sizeof(blocked), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00909     pack_write(f, (void*)&sig, sizeof(sig), 0, FROM_KERNEL);
00910   }
00911         
00912   ret = 0;
00913         
00914  out:   
00915   pack_write(f, NULL, 0, 1, FROM_KERNEL); /* last packet */
00916 
00917   free_page((unsigned long)buffer);
00918   kfree(fdcache);       
00919   kfree(pth);
00920 
00921   /* THE END */
00922   set_fs(fs);
00923         
00924   return ret;
00925 }
00926 
00927 /* ************************************************************************** */
00928 
00929 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00930 
00939 static int ckpt_flush_old_exec(char * filename, struct file * file) 
00940 {
00941   // we use the funciton kernel already has
00942   struct linux_binprm bin;
00943   memset(&bin, 0, sizeof(bin));
00944   bin.filename = filename;
00945   bin.file = file;
00946   return flush_old_exec(&bin);
00947 }
00948 
00954 static inline unsigned long get_mmap_flags(unsigned short vm_flags) 
00955 {
00956 
00957   return MAP_FIXED |
00958     (vm_flags & VM_MAYSHARE? MAP_SHARED : MAP_PRIVATE) |
00959     (vm_flags & VM_GROWSDOWN) |
00960     (vm_flags & VM_DENYWRITE) |
00961     (vm_flags & VM_EXECUTABLE);
00962 }
00963 
00971 static struct file * open_private_file(int fd, const char *filename, int flags, int mode) 
00972 {
00973   struct file * file = NULL;
00974   struct dentry *d;
00975   struct nameidata nd;
00976     
00978   if (ckpt_open_namei(fd, filename, flags, 0, &nd))
00979     goto out;  
00980   
00981   file = (struct file*)kmalloc(sizeof(struct file), GFP_KERNEL);
00982   if (!file){
00983     if (verbose) printk("not file");
00984     goto out;
00985   }
00986   
00987   d = nd.path.dentry;
00988 
00989   if (IS_ERR(d)){
00990     if (verbose) printk("is err d");
00991     goto out;
00992   }
00993   
00994   if (!d->d_inode || !d->d_inode->i_op
00995       || !d->d_inode->i_fop){
00996     if (verbose) printk("d stuff");
00997     goto out; 
00998   }
00999 
01000   /* Does dentry_open set vfsmnt? */
01001   if (verbose) printk("before dentry open");
01002   file->f_vfsmnt = nd.path.mnt;
01003   file = dentry_open(d, nd.path.mnt, mode);
01004 
01005  out:
01006   return file;
01007 }
01008 
01020 static int restart(int fd, const char * fname, pid_t pid, int flags) 
01021 {
01022   struct file *f = NULL;
01023   struct header hdr;
01024   struct segments seg;
01025   struct memory mem;
01026   struct open_files open_files;
01027   struct open_files_hdr open_files_hdr;
01028   struct pt_regs regs;
01029   char * filename = NULL;
01030   int ret, i, skippad;
01031   mm_segment_t fs;
01032   unsigned long int oldsize;
01033   int err;
01034 
01035 #ifdef PRINT_TIME
01036   long long hr_time1, hr_time2;
01037   gettsc(&hr_time1);
01038 #endif
01039 
01040   fs = get_fs();
01041 
01042   filename = getname((char*)fname);
01043 
01044   err = PTR_ERR(filename);
01045   if (IS_ERR(filename))
01046     goto out;
01047 
01048   err = -ENOMEM;
01049         
01050   f = open_private_file(fd, filename, 1, 1);
01051 
01052   // get dentry from filename (see file_open in fs/open.c)
01053 
01054   /* Error checks on file initialization from above call. */
01055   if (!f || !f->f_op || !f->f_op->read) {
01056     printk("null pointer\n");
01057     goto out;
01058   }     
01059         
01060   f->f_pos = 0;
01061 
01062   ckpt_flush_old_exec(filename, f);
01063         
01064   set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
01065         
01066   /* Read in the header */
01067   ret = f->f_op->read(f, (char*)&hdr, sizeof(hdr), &f->f_pos);
01068   
01069   if ((ret != sizeof(hdr)) || ckpt_strncmp(hdr.signature, "CKPT", 4) ||
01070       hdr.major_version != CKPT_MAJOR ||
01071       hdr.minor_version != CKPT_MINOR) {
01072     printk("Invalid checkpoint file\n");
01073     goto out;
01074   }
01075 
01076   if (((hdr.uid != current->euid && hdr.uid != current->uid)
01077        && (current->uid && current->euid))) {
01078     err = -EACCES;
01079     goto out;
01080   }
01081 
01082   /* restore uid/gid */ 
01083   if (current->uid == 0 || current->euid == 0) {
01084     current->uid = hdr.uid;
01085     current->euid = hdr.euid;
01086     current->suid = hdr.suid;
01087     current->fsuid = hdr.fsuid;
01088     current->gid = hdr.gid;
01089     current->egid = hdr.egid;
01090     current->sgid = hdr.sgid;
01091     current->fsgid = hdr.fsgid;
01092     current->group_info->ngroups = hdr.ngroups;
01093   }
01094         
01095   if (verbose)
01096     printk("Reading header: %d segments\n",hdr.num_segments);
01097 
01098   // restore command name
01099   ckpt_strncpy(current->comm, hdr.comm, 16);
01100         
01101   putname(filename); /* free up the name we allocated */
01102   filename = NULL;
01103 
01104   current->state=TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE;
01105 
01106   /* Read the memory mapping */
01107   if (verbose)
01108     printk("Restoring vm structure\n");
01109         
01110   f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&mem, sizeof(struct memory), &f->f_pos);
01111 
01112   current->mm->start_code  = mem.start_code;
01113   current->mm->end_code    = mem.end_code;
01114   current->mm->start_data  = mem.start_data;
01115   current->mm->end_data    = mem.end_data;
01116   current->mm->start_brk   = mem.start_brk;
01117   current->mm->brk         = mem.brk;
01118   current->mm->start_stack = mem.start_stack;
01119   current->mm->arg_start   = mem.arg_start;
01120   current->mm->arg_end     = mem.arg_end;
01121   current->mm->env_start   = mem.env_start;
01122   current->mm->env_end     = mem.env_end;
01123 
01124   /* Calculate the number of bytes (round to pages) to skip after headers */
01125   skippad = (hdr.num_segments * sizeof(struct segments)) + sizeof(struct header) + sizeof(struct memory); 
01126   if (skippad%PAGE_SIZE!=0)
01127     skippad = (skippad/PAGE_SIZE + 1)*PAGE_SIZE;        
01128 
01129   oldsize = 0;
01130 
01131   if (verbose)
01132     printk("Restoring vm areas\n");
01133 
01134   /* Map all the segments */
01135   for (i=0; i<hdr.num_segments; i++) {
01136     unsigned long size;
01137     unsigned long mmap_prot, mmap_flags;
01138 
01139     set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
01140     err = -EIO;
01141     f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&seg, sizeof(struct segments), &f->f_pos);
01142 
01143     size = seg.vm_end - seg.vm_start;
01144 
01145     set_fs(fs);
01146 
01147     /* *** MMAP *** */
01148     mmap_prot = seg.flags & 7;
01149     mmap_flags = get_mmap_flags(seg.flags);
01150     if (!seg.shared) {
01151       mmap_flags &= ~VM_EXECUTABLE;
01152     }
01153           
01154     if (!seg.shared) {
01155 
01156       ret = do_mmap(f, seg.vm_start, size, mmap_prot,
01157                     mmap_flags|MAP_FIXED, skippad+oldsize);
01158     }
01159     else {
01160       struct file *file;
01161       //            struct dentry *d;
01162       //            struct nameidata nd;
01163       int omode = O_RDONLY;
01164             
01165       set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
01166           
01167       if ( (mmap_prot&PROT_WRITE) && (mmap_flags&MAP_SHARED) &&
01168            !(mmap_flags&MAP_DENYWRITE)) 
01169         omode = O_RDWR;
01170 
01171       //            file = open_exec(seg.filename);
01172       file = open_private_file(fd, seg.filename, omode,
01173                                mmap_prot&PROT_WRITE? 3:1);
01174             
01175       set_fs(fs);
01176 
01177       if (!(mmap_flags&MAP_PRIVATE) && !(mmap_flags&MAP_SHARED))
01178         mmap_flags |= MAP_PRIVATE|MAP_DENYWRITE|MAP_EXECUTABLE;
01179 
01180       ret = do_mmap_pgoff(file, seg.vm_start, size, mmap_prot,
01181                           mmap_flags|MAP_FIXED, seg.pgoff);
01182 
01183       if (ret != seg.vm_start)
01184         printk("Error in mmap %08lx!\n", seg.vm_start);
01185             
01186       size = 0; /* We haven't used the checkpointed file! */
01187 
01188     }
01189 
01190     if (ret!=seg.vm_start) {
01191       printk(KERN_WARNING "Restart: Mapping error at map #%d.",i); 
01192       printk(KERN_WARNING "Sent %lX and got %X (%ld)\n", seg.vm_start, ret, (signed long)ret);
01193       err = -EFAULT;
01194       goto out;
01195     }
01196 
01197     oldsize += size;
01198   }
01199         
01200   set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
01201 
01202   /* Skip all segments and go to the next section in the file */
01203   if (!f->f_op->llseek)
01204     f->f_pos = oldsize + skippad;
01205   else
01206     f->f_op->llseek(f, oldsize+skippad, 0);
01207         
01208   /* Read in the registers to our stack, so when this system call
01209      exits we jump to our new code */
01210   if (verbose)
01211     printk("Restoring registers\n");
01212 
01213   f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&regs, sizeof(regs), &f->f_pos);
01214   *(((struct pt_regs *) (2*PAGE_SIZE + (unsigned long) current)) - 1)
01215     = regs;     
01216 
01217   /*   FILES   */
01218   if (verbose)
01219     printk("Restoring file table\n");
01220         
01221   err = -EIO;
01222         
01223   if (f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&open_files_hdr, sizeof(struct open_files_hdr), &f->f_pos) 
01224       != sizeof(struct open_files_hdr)) {
01225     goto out;
01226   }
01227 
01228   for (i=0; i<open_files_hdr.number_open_files; i++) {
01229     struct file *fdes;
01230     struct inode *inode;
01231 
01232     if (f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&open_files, sizeof(struct open_files), &f->f_pos) 
01233         != sizeof(struct open_files)) {
01234       err = -EIO;
01235       goto out;
01236     }
01237           
01238     fdes = current->files->fdt->fd[open_files.fd];
01239     inode = fdes->f_dentry->d_inode;
01240           
01241     switch (open_files.type) {
01242     case CKPT_DUP:
01243     case CKPT_FILE:         
01244       /* We don't need to do anything, since 
01245          someone (restart) has already dupped/opened the 
01246          file. We just skip this entry.
01247       */
01248 
01249       f->f_pos+=open_files.entry_size;
01250       break;
01254       /*      
01255     case CKPT_PIPE:
01256       if ( !fdes ||
01257            !S_ISFIFO(inode->i_mode) ) {
01258         printk("WARNING: restart: fd %d was not previously open or is not a pipe!!!\n",open_files.fd);
01259 
01260         send_sig(SIGKILL, current, 0);
01261         goto out;
01262       }
01263             
01264       // Now read the information left in the pipe
01265       if (open_files.entry_size>0) {
01266         f->f_op->read(f, (void*)PIPE_BASE(*inode), open_files.entry_size, &f->f_pos);
01267         PIPE_LEN(*inode)+=open_files.entry_size;
01268       }
01269       break;
01270       */
01271     case CKPT_SOCK:
01272       printk("Socket not supported\n");
01273       err = -ENOSYS;
01274       goto out;
01275     }
01276   }
01277 
01278   /**************************************/
01279   /*                CWD                 */
01280   /**************************************/
01281 
01282   // has been changed to in user space, so skip
01283   {
01284     int size;
01285     f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&size, sizeof(int), &f->f_pos);
01286     f->f_pos += size; /* skip cwd */
01287   }
01288 
01289   /******************/
01290   /*    SIGNALS     */
01291   /******************/
01292 
01293   if (verbose)
01294     printk("Restoring signal handlers\n");
01295   {
01296     sigset_t blocked;
01297     struct sighand_struct sighand;
01298     int i;
01299 
01300     f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&blocked, sizeof(sigset_t), &f->f_pos);
01301     f->f_op->read(f, (void*)&sighand, sizeof(sighand), &f->f_pos);
01302 
01303     spin_lock_irq(&current->sighand->siglock);   
01304           
01305     current->blocked = blocked;
01306     for (i = 0; i < _NSIG; i++)
01307       current->sighand->action[i] = sighand.action[i];
01308           
01309     spin_unlock_irq(&current->sighand->siglock);
01310   }
01311 
01312   err = 0;
01313         
01314   /* THE END */
01316   /* don't free file handler 'f', because it's mmaped somewhere. I hope munmap will get rid of it */
01317         
01318   current->state = TASK_RUNNING;
01319 
01320   if (flags & RESTART_STOP) {
01321     if (verbose)
01322       printk("Currently stopped\n");
01323 
01324     send_sig(SIGSTOP, current, 0);
01325   }
01326 
01327   if (verbose)
01328     printk("*** RESTART: done ***\n");
01329 
01330   if (hdr.in_sys_call)
01331     err = regs.orig_ax;         // returns the number of the original syscall.
01332 
01333   else
01334     err = 0;
01335         
01336  out:
01337   if (err < 0 && verbose)
01338     printk("restart error: %d\n", -err);
01339         
01340   set_fs(fs);
01341 
01342   if (filename)
01343     putname(filename);
01344 
01345   if (flags & RESTART_NOTIFY) {
01346     // we need to notify someone
01347 
01348     //    struct task_struct * p = current->p_pptr;
01349     struct task_struct * p = current->parent;
01350     // if pid == 0 notify parent
01351 
01352     if (pid > 0)
01353       p = ckpt_find_task_by_pid(pid);
01354 
01355     if (p) {
01356 
01357       if (verbose)
01358         printk("Notifying process %d\n", p->pid);
01359 
01360       send_sig(SIGUSR1, p, 0); // let him know!
01361     }
01362   }
01363 #ifdef PRINT_TIME
01364   gettsc(&hr_time2);
01365   printk("restart %s: %lu, %lu\n", current->comm, hi_word(hr_time2 - hr_time1), lo_word(hr_time2 - hr_time1));
01366 #endif  
01367         
01368   return err;           
01369 }
01370 
01371 /* Device Declarations **************************** */
01372 
01373 /* The name for our device, as it will appear 
01374  * in /proc/devices */
01375 #define DEVICE_NAME "ckpt"
01376 
01377 static int ckpt_open(struct inode *inode, 
01378                      struct file *file) {
01379   return 0;
01380 }
01381 
01382 static int ckpt_release(struct inode *inode, 
01383                         struct file *file) {
01384   return 0;
01385 }
01386 
01390 int ckpt_ioctl(struct inode * inode_i, struct file * file,
01391                unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg) {
01392   struct ckpt_param param;
01393 
01394   /* Quick error checking. */
01395   if(_IOC_TYPE(cmd) != CKPT_MAGIC) return -ENOTTY;
01396   if(_IOC_NR(cmd) > CKPT_MAX_IOC_NR) return -ENOTTY;
01397   
01398   // arg is the pointer to ckpt_param
01399   if (copy_from_user(&param, (struct ckpt_param *)arg, sizeof(struct ckpt_param)))
01400     return -EFAULT;
01401 
01402   if (verbose)
01403     printk("pid is %d, cmd is %d\n", param.pid, cmd);
01404   
01405   // do checkpoint/restart here
01406   switch(cmd){
01407   case CKPT_IOCTL_CHECKPOINT:
01408     printk("Running a checkpoint...\n");
01409     return checkpoint(param.f.fd, param.pid, param.flags);
01410     break;
01411   case CKPT_IOCTL_RESTART:
01412     return restart(param.f.fd, param.f.filename, param.pid, param.flags);
01413     break;
01414   default:
01415     return -EINVAL;    
01416   }
01417 }
01418 
01419 /* Module Declarations ***************************** */
01420 
01421 static int major;
01422 
01423 struct file_operations ckpt_fops = {
01424  owner:         THIS_MODULE,
01425  ioctl:         ckpt_ioctl,
01426  open:          ckpt_open,
01427  release:       ckpt_release,
01428 };
01429 
01430 struct cdev ckpt_cdev;
01431 
01432 static void setup_ckpt_cdev(dev_t devno)
01433 {
01434   int err;
01435   
01436   cdev_init(&ckpt_cdev, &ckpt_fops);
01437   ckpt_cdev.owner = THIS_MODULE;
01438   ckpt_cdev.ops = &ckpt_fops;
01439   err = cdev_add(&ckpt_cdev, devno, 1);
01440   
01441   if(err)
01442     printk(KERN_WARNING "Error %d adding ckpt device", err);
01443 }
01444 
01445 
01446 static int ckpt_init(void) 
01447 {
01448   int result;
01449   dev_t dev;
01450 
01451   result = alloc_chrdev_region(&dev, 0, 1, DEVICE_NAME);  
01452   if(result < 0){
01453     printk("Error allocating device ckpt w/ major %d.\n", major);
01454     return result;
01455   }
01456 
01457   major = MAJOR(dev);
01458   setup_ckpt_cdev(dev);
01459 
01460   return 0;
01461 }
01462 
01463 static void ckpt_cleanup(void) 
01464 {
01465   cdev_del(&ckpt_cdev);
01466   unregister_chrdev_region(MKDEV(major,0), 1);
01467 }
01468 
01469 module_init(ckpt_init);
01470 module_exit(ckpt_cleanup);
01471 
01472 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
Generated on Fri Aug 8 02:33:31 2008 by  1.5.5
